Name: Monopoly: Montpellier
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Montpellier, in France.

Name: Taistelurekka
Description:
From the box cover: "Taistelu Rekka - adventure game of the future"

The game takes place in the USA in 2032. The population has centered to seven metropolises. Players are truck drivers trying to earn money by transporting goods from city to city, through the dangerous deserts where battles with bandits can be fatal.

The first player to save enough money to buy out his truck is the winner.

The name of this Finnish game is "Battletruck" in English. While probably a completely domestic design, it was almost certainly inspired by the 1982 film of the same name, as well as other post-apocalyptic road movies popular at the time, such as the Mad Max series.

Name: Sheng Guan Tu
Description:
Sheng Guan Tu means "Promotion Official Chart" in English.  It is a classic Chinese game similar to Chutes and Ladders or Kang Le Qi. The game is allegedly from the Ming dynasty and was created by the calligrapher Ni Yuan-Lu.  The game plays with a top that is similar to a Teetotum or Jewish Dreidel. The person who reaches the last promotion wins.

Promotion games such as this one and Hor Lor Boon were very popular in ancient China.  Parents often encourage their children to play promotion games, hoping that the games would stimulate the children to work hard on the track to officialdom.

During the Cultural Revolution, the game was banned and has since been out of print.

Name: WWE Undisputed The Board Game
Description:
WWE Undisputed The Board Game allows players to take on the role of one of WWE top Wrestling Superstars, Triple H, Kurt Angle, The Undertaker or Hulk Hogan.

Players take turns moving their Superstar around the board until they collect  cards that they can use later in the game.  When a Superstar lands on a Match Fight space the player may challenge any other player to a Wrestling Match, preferably a player who holds a Championship Belt (Harcore, European, Intercontinental & World Heavyweight).  The Wrestlers Fight by putting their Superstars in the ring in the middle of the board and playing Grapple Cards.

The objective of the game is to win all four Championship Belts.

Name: Mulligan
Description:
From the rules:
Mulligan - the mind game to challenge your golf skills.

Mulligan is a game where you can acquire knowledge about the rules of golf, the history of golf and about golf technique.  Mulligan has been designed like a proper golf course, consisting of 9 holes (alternatively 18 holes by playing 9 holes twice).  The holes are of different length and difficulty.  At each hole you get information of par and distance of the hole, as you find it on any real golf course.  Mulligan is an entertaining knowledge game giving the players a good opportunity to learn or freshen up on the rules of golf and etiquette.

During the play the players will encounter all the elements that they find during a real round of golf, like bunkers, out of bounds and water hazards.

Quick description:
A challenging golf trivia game that comes with golf course board, score cards, golf ball die, tees, and trivia cards all in a wooden display box.  The also game comes with rules to complete using the Stableford system, stroke play, and match play.

Name: Boa Viagem
Description:
Boa Viagem (Portuguese for "Have a Nice Trip"): A trip around the world in a funny competition game.

At the start of the game, each player receives a card with the destinations they have to visit in the game. Players must start at Iberian Peninsula and travel around the world collecting souvenirs of the indicated destinations received in their initial card.

Players have to plan their routes using roads, boats and plains paying attention to their money to avoiding spending all their money and consequently loose the game.

The player that will win is the first player who visit all the destinations of his card and return to the starting point.

Name: Oil Well
Description:
OIL WELL from the Bemus Game Company, 641 Gracelawn Ave. Flint, Michigan.

From the Box:  Drill for Black Gold, Be a Texas Millionaire, A Game of fun for young and old. Has an outer ring resembling Monopoly and an inner area with Roads and Properties with well sites. Landing on the appropriate areas on the outer ring allows you to drill on the well sites in the inner area.

Name: The Sword and the Flame: Event Deck
Description:
This is a set of 48 event cards for The Sword and the Flame miniatures game, 30 of which are unique. There are events for the British side as well as "Natives". Some of the cards are titled "Universal Misery" and contain events affecting both sides. The cards cover reinforcements and low ammunition, but also include more exotic occurrences.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.
Families: Game: The Sword and the Flame

Name: Las Vegas
Description:
Las Vegas is a luck based game of betting and tile placement. The game consists of a board with two spinners a betting field for each player and a central board for placing your coulored chips. Initially you place your bet on your betting field. The first player then proceeds to spin both spinners. From the first he gets a colour and a number from the second just a number. The player now has the option to place his chip on one of the two numbered fields he spun inside the spinned colours area.
The aim is to be the first player to connect four in a row (horizontally, vertically or diagonal). This will net you 5 times your bet. If you have 3 in a row you get double all others loses the wagered amount. Then a new round starts.
There are more additional rules for what happens if no 4 in a row can possibly be placed and for 500.- you can buy a dice roll which creates an additional number. Furthermore you can get jokers from spinning/dice rolling which allow free selection of the placing field.
The game ends after 4 rounds of chip placement or after a set amount of cash has been earned what ever you decide at the beginning.

Name: Pursuit
Description: The game is manufactured by Are-Jay Game Co. Inc., Cleveland, Ohio.  It comes with a wooden board that is attached to the box along with pegs and a die. For 2, 3 or 4 players.   I could find no date for the game.

Name: Pluto's Big Bike Racing Game
Description: American cycling themed racing game. Each player has his own track and he who reaches the end first is the winner. No dice are used though, movement is determined by a set of seven race cards for each player.

Name: La Grande Boucle 1954
Description: Small French game published in July 1954 about the Tour de France. The game works with dice but strangely enough the players get rewarded for throwing low numbers.

Name: Quests of the Librarian
Description:
Each player takes the role of the Librarian. Players try to retrieve precious artifacts to expand the Library Collection. Based on the 'Librarian' Series of Movies.

The game uses two custom card decks, an Action Deck and an Artifact Deck as well as a six-sided die for determining Initiative each round and the number of Fate cards drawn from the Action deck.

The Action Deck is composed of 80 cards divided into 8 suits of 10 cards. The suits are Knowledge, Danger, Travel, Companion, Escape, Foe, Puzzle, and Location.

The Artifact Deck is composed of 27 cards, each of which grants a special ability to the player controlling it. Artifact cards are acquired by playing melds of Action cards.

The game is won by collecting a certain number of Artifacts. The players choose the game length prior to play - from a "Short Game" (3 Artifacts) to a "Full Game" (9 Artifacts).

Basic game play is for an Artifact and a number of actions (Fate cards) to be displayed.  Players collect action cards into their hand attempting to collect a meld of 8 different suites in order to claim the artifact.  If no player can claim the Artifact, it remains in play for the next round.

Artifacts currently in player control and optionally disposed of action cards can be used to modify the flow of the game.

Name: Wonder Woman Justice League of America Game
Description: Features: Aquaman, Batman, Flash, Superman, Green Lantern, and Jonn Jonzz Super Hero cards along with Wonderwoman in a simple roll and move game from Hasbro.

Name: ADDO
Description: ADDO is a Bingo variant where the "banker" draws chits containing sums (from 0 + 0 to 9 + 9) and calls out the two numbers.  The players then check to see if they have the answer printed on their card. The first player to cover all 9 numbers on his/her card wins.

Name: Lirum Larum Essenspiel
Description:
Players move around a market and pick up cards with various foodstuffs. They have to collect seven different types of food in order to win.
There are also rules for some other game ideas included.

Name: Lustiges Schrobenhausener Spargelstechen
Description: Two players start at opposing ends of the game board, which is made from wood and depicts an asparagus field which contains little wooden asparagus. The players now roll dice and move along certain tracks, in opposing directions (without getting into each others way), following instructions on certain fields or just harvesting the asparagus. When one player reaches his or her destination, the player with most asparagus wins.

Name: Beezi
Description:
Beezi: The S-P-E-L-L-I-N-G Game

This spelling game uses a special six-sided die with different bees on it - Stinger, Queen Bee, Honey Bee, Bumble Bee, Digger Bee, Killer Bee. On a player's turn, the die is rolled and depending on the bee that appears, the player draws a card (different bees have different degrees of difficulty) with a word to spell on it. The card is passed to the player on the left, who acts as Beekeeper and says the word on the card. All other players try to spell the word on their writing pad. If the player whose turn it is spells it correctly the player gets the indicated number of beez which are then placed on a honeycomb board; if that player misspells the word, the other players who spelled the word correctly get a beez, Rolling the Stinger causes a missed turn, and the Queen Bee gives the opportunity to earn double the number of beez.

Name: L'Anniversaire des triplés
Description: In this game; you attempt to fill your birthday cake appropriately by rolling the dice and playing cards.  The special dice allow you to advance by the number of faces you see with two boys and a girl showing allowing you to advance six.  What is neat is you can use your own birthday month as the chance to score a candle.  Great bits make this a relatively interesting game.

Name: Kofferpacken
Description:
From the publisher:

The children find a magic suitcase, hidden in an old attic and they are eager to discover what they can do with it . Their surprise is enormous when they find that they can pack anything they want in it. They have a great idea for a game. Pack the bag, with plenty of room for imagination. Who will be the first to pack all their things into the suitcase? 
8 Cards with a question mark allow the players to put in what ever they want.

Tin box game from HABA

Name: Hell's Kitchen: The Board Game
Description:
Welcome to Hell's Kitchen, where the chef's word is law.  As the latest trainees in the kitchen, you have a full day ahead of you.  It's not simply a matter of serving cool culinary creations, there's a lot of hard work first.  The day starts with preparing the ingredients for today's menu.  Only then can you start cooking - and you'd better have everything ready by the time service starts.  And meet chef's standards.

In the game, players prepare ingredients according to the recipes for the dishes they're cooking.  They can take advantage of the ingredients other players prepare to get their dish ready quickly.  Then it's time for service and we find out who's got it right - and whose dishes are going in the bin.  Remember: if you can't take the heat, stay out of Hell's Kitchen!

Similar to Mamma Mia!, but now with a new theme and some new rules.

Name: Mathador
Description:
Mathador is a mathematical educational game.

You move trough the board answering arithmetic questions and resolving mathematical quizzes.

Home Page: http://www.mathador.fr/ (French)

Name: Mathador Junior
Description:
Mathador Junior is a mathematical educational game, a Junior version from the original Mathador Game.

You move trough the board answering arithmetic questions and resolving mathematical quizzes.

Name: Mathador Kid
Description:
Mathador Kids is a mathematical educational game from the designer of Mathador.

It consists of 25 little games played with large dice which involve mathematical operations.

Name: Instant Thunder
Description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for jets equipped with guns and missiles. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns, similar to Gary Graber's Göring's War.

Jets have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each jet to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Jets may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting cannon fire and missiles is preformed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the jets are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and complete aircraft statistics for any period from the Korean War to present.

A short introduction to the rules, focusing on the Vietnam era, is available in Wargames Illustrated No. 254 (December 2008), under the name "Very Instant Thunder".

Name: Re
Description:
Re is a popular Chess variant.

The game is played on a 5x5 board. When the game starts, the board is empty. Each player starts with 10 player pieces: One king, one queen, two rooks, two knights, two bishops, and two pawns.

On your turn, you can do one of the following three things:


    Put one of your pieces (not yet put into play) on an empty square on the board.
    Make a capture with one of your pieces on the board.
    Pass. Note: This may only be done when you have put all your pieces on the board.


When both players pass consecutively or when all pieces of a player have been taken, the game ends. Each player earns points for their remaining pieces on the board: 3 points for each king or queen, two points for each rook, knight, or bishop, and one point for each pawn. Each player counts the total number of points for the pieces they have taken, and the player with the largest number of points wins the game (the score is the difference between the point totals).

Originally published as Spielbox Edition No.8 in Spielbox issue 2/1994.

Name: Damix
Description:
DAMIX is an innovative game based on observation, tactics and moving in a 3 dimensions environment based on a territory of 6 sides of different colors.

Goal of the game : The Goal for each player is to choose 1 color and to transfer the pawns to the opposite side of the cube as fast as possible.

The winner is the player or the players who in the same round has located all the pawns on the opposite side of the same color in a cross pattern.

FAST GAME : the winner is the first player who locate the 8 pawns in his territory (16 possible patterns).

Game Advise : Do not let one pawn standing alone as each move will cost one round…

One player game : The target of the game is to bring the pawns to the opposite side with a minimum of moves.
Sudoku Colors play option available .

Name: Total Axis Pack II
Description:
A follow on to Total Axis Pack I: Eastern Front Firestorm.

While the pack features the typical set of German, Russian, American and Minor power forces, Scenarios TAP 21 and 22 feature the Italians vs. the Japanese in Peking and Tientsin China in September 1943.

Scenario pack contents:

     12 scenarios - TAP 13-24
     Map board - 32x9 hex map named TXP1
     Special Rules
     Cover/Title sheet
     Informational back sheet.


This scenario pack is not a complete game. Beyond Valor and Armies of Oblivion are required to play this games as Total Axis Pack I and geomorphic boards 19, 42, 10 21, 23, 45, 46, 51, and Deluxe A.  Ownership of Jatkosota: Finland at War is suggested.

Name: Fun with Rhymes
Description: Recognize, identify, and match rhyming endings in three different educational games played on the same game board.

Name: The Classification Game
Description:
This is a boxed set of four brightly colored cardboard scenes that fit together to stand up in a three dimensional display: a toy collection, clothes closet, zoo, and grocery. Each scene has twelve printed tiles of images that belong in that scene.

The object is to classify the image cards into the correct scenario. Does the bunny go in the grocery store, or the closet?

Gameplay can be expanded to include an entire classroom or smaller groups as players fit their items into logical groupings to encourage the development of organizational and classification skills.

Name: Retro Pak I
Description:
Scenario Pack Contents

     8 scenarios
     Cover Sheet
     Back informational sheet


7 European and one Pacific theater scenarios.  These are older out of print Critical Hit scenarios that have been reworked and updated.  Critical hit says that this is first of a series of reworked, updated and renamed scenario packs.

One of the scenarios is Guadalcanal, another early war, eastern front 1941. The rest are mid-late war. All of the scenarios even the Guadalcanal one feature tanks, and several of the scenarios feature well known and/or heavy tanks, the Panther, Tigers, Tiger IIs, JgPz V, SU-152, JgdPz V, ISU-122, and the Joseph Stalin II.

As with all scenario packs this is not a complete game, Ownership of Beyond Valor, Yanks, Gung Ho, Code of Bushido as well as Geomorphic boards 2,6,9,17,37,41,42, 44,46,47,48,49 is required.

Name: Euro-Pack II: The Battle of the Bulge
Description: Euro-Pack II: The Battle of the Bulge is a set of eight scenarios designed for the ASL (Advanced Squad Leader) system. Set includes Euro-Pack scenarios #62, 12, 52, 54, 53, 45, 10 and 20. Scenario directions are done in the standard ASL style, printed on heavy cardstock in black, gray (German) and green (American). Critical Hit describes this set as follows: "In a strange twist of corporate logic the gang at Critical Hit decided to present you an interesting set of scenarios depicting Bulge actions in Belgium, fought over places like Ligneuville, Cour, and Thirimont designed by...yes, Belgians! Not your ordinary Belgians, but the kind that walk battlefields and pore over every minute detail of the engagements." Like most ASL scenario packs, this is not a complete game and requires ownership of the necessary counters from other sources. Playing the scenarios also requires ownership of standard ASL mapboards/mapsheets N#1, 40, 18, 12, 24, St., 17, 19, 4, 41, 16, 18, 9, 18, 13 and 4.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Paduk
Description: Paduk is a traditional game of Korean origin usually played on the specially marked inner 9 by 9 grid of the Go board. Players own two sorts of pieces, called stones (round) and columns (square). The stones are able to move, the columns stay on their places, until a player breaks the game, then all columns of this player go to the hand of this player for new placing. A player is not allowed to break the game twice, the hostile side must break the game also. Object of the game is to form geometrical positions of four on the board, which are formed of the two sorts of pieces. After the first move Paduk offers more movement possibilities than Go and clearly more than Chess.

Name: Le Havre Expansion: Essen Promo Cards
Description:
At the Essen Game Fair of 2008, Lookout Games had a special 12 card Special Building promo pack for their new game, Le Havre.

After the Fair, Hanno of Lookout Games held a charity auction for the expansion for those who could not attend the Essen Game Fair.

This expansion is included in the 2017 edition of Le Havre.

The set includes:




    
         Nr

         English

         Deutsch

    
    
         00

         Dunny

         Toilettenhäuschen

    
    
         036

         Worker's Cottages

         Arbeitersiedlung

    
    
         037

         Construction Site

         Baustelle

    
    
         038

         Logging Camp

         Holzfällerlager

    
    
         039

         MS Dagmar

         MS Dagmar

    
    
         040

         Pawnbroker's

         Pfandleihe

    
    
         041

         Pirate's Lair

         Piratennest

    
    
         042

         Junkyard

         Schrottplatz

    
    
         043

         Dive Bar

         Spelunke

    
    
         044

         Picket Line

         Streikposten

    
    
         045

         Tobacco Factory

         Tabakmanufaktur

    
    
         046

         Cattle Drive

         Viehtrieb

    



Expands:

    Le Havre

Name: Penny Push
Description:
Penny Push Game

A very simple but enjoyable game that combines
basic physical agility and strategy.

Use 6 pennies or dimes on a smooth tabletop (great for playing at a cafe).

Each player on opposite sides of the table places
3 coins on the table in a triangle, approx. 3 inches
apart (one player can be heads and the other
tails).

Each player takes turns flicking a coin with his
finger so that it passes in between his other two
coins, thus moving his triangle step by step
across the table.

No coin can be moved twice in a row, so with each
move the coin must pass far enough between the
other two coins to leave enough room for the next
move.

The game can end in four ways.

When a player moves a coin, that player loses if:


     The coin fails to pass completely between the other two coins
     The coin falls off the edge of the table, or
     The coin touches any other coin.


That player wins if none of the above occur, and
the coin passes completely through two sides of
the opposing player's triangle of coins.

The strategy of the game is to move your coins
cautiously into range of the other player's
coins, putting them in position to take a shot
through your opponent's triangle without leaving
your coins too far apart and vulnerable to
attack. You look for an opening without leaving
yourself open. The edge of the table can be used
as a defensive position.

The game can be played in matches, playing up to
a predetermined number of wins, or best of a set
number of games.

Name: Hammer & Nails
Description:
Spin the spinner, pick a piece, and hammer it in with the little hammer.

This is a kids game that is intended to develop fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination.

It uses a small hammer, and real metal nails.

Name: Was ist Was: Junior – Ritterburg Kartenspiel
Description:
Was ist Was: Junior – Ritterburg Kartenspiel has an educational aim: by reading (or getting read) the texts on the cards, the children learn details of daily life in a medieval castle. In order to complete certain tasks, like "There is a feast at the castle. Eat with the noble knights and lead the ladies to dance", you need to collect specific sets of cards (in the case of a feast: juggler, vegetables and roast).

You draw cards until you can complete one of three outlying tasks, then take the task-card, adding the worth of tasks once the pile of cards has been emptied.

Name: 5°Dimension Playing Card Game
Description:
The 5th Dimension Playing Card Game is actually a five-suited deck of playing cards based on the traditional 52-card deck. In addition to the added suit (stars), the 5D deck gives each suit its own unique color and theme. It also adds a '1' card (distinct from the ace) and a 'P' (princess) face card, as well as including a joker for each suit. Thus, the deck includes 80 cards in total.

The deck has been made available in a number of different formats that differ in packaging, accessories (such as score sheets), and game rules included. The publisher's web site  www.jeudecartes5d.com provided rules for 14 games as of the end of 2008, albeit only in French.

Name: Scene It? To Go!: Jr.
Description:
All the fun of the original kids’ game in a compact case. 
Enjoy real movie, TV, sports and music clips, trivia questions and on-screen challenges.

For Ages 8 and up, 2-8 People
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Scene It? To Go!: Disney
Description:
Questions based on Disney Pixar characters and movies with real movie clips and trivia questions. Comes with on-screen trivia cards and dice, 1 game DVD, game board and 4 magnetic tokens. Similar to Disney Scene it, but travel form.

* Requires a DVD player and viewing screen(not included)
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Arctic Survival
Description: Arctic Survival is about using your instincts to prevail in the coldest and most remote place on earth. The object is to make it safely to your igloo before your opponent can make it safely to theirs. In the way are treacherous moving ice floes, with icebergs and thin ice blocking your path. Lurking within are friendly and unfriendly Orca whales and smart penguins that can guide the way across the ice floes. Once across, unfriendly polar bears, wolves and many other types of arctic wildlife confront you as you try to reach the safety and comfort of the igloo waiting across this vast ever changing environment.

Name: Pirates Ahoy Game
Description: The pirate's are leaving port in their ships and are racing to the treasure island. As you help them sail the seven seas, guess which ship will reach the treasure island first and which will reach it last.

Name: Monopoly: Here & Now UK Edition
Description: The classic Monopoly with unique properties and other elements of the United Kingdom - as voted by its citizens.

Name: Mary
Description:
Mary, a.k.a. Ladybirds, contains a wooden tray with three sets of ten squared tiles with different patterns:


    10 ladybugs, with each ladybug bearing a number of dots from 1 to 10
    10 puddles of paint, each of a different color
    10 pictures of different colors with simple shapes (umbrella, kite, worm...)


The player needs to arrange these tiles in the tray with respect to colors and/or numbers.

Name: Arabian Nights
Description:
This Arabian Nights adventure appeals to all ages with its fantastical tale of Abu, the little thief who befriends Achmed, the prince of Bagdad and foils the nefarious plans of the evil grand vizier Jaffar, who seizes control of Bagdad and covets the princess of Basra. From its gorgeous, epic-scale sets to flying horses, magic carpets, all-seeing crystals, blue rose of forgetfullness, and, best of all, Rex Ingram's towering Djinni of the bottle.

Free all locations and the regime headed by Jaffar from power in Basra so that Achmed was married with the princess.

Name: Juke Joint
Description:
Juke Joint is a turn-based scramble whose objective is for players to pay off their "bar tab" first.  Players accomplish this by accumulating money by performing success rolls in eight different areas of the board (the Pool Room, Stage, Horsehose Pit, Jukebox, BBQ Pit, Store Room and the Crossroads) which pay money, then transporting that money back to the Bar.

Players draw "Club" cards each turn which may result in immediate actions, people encounters, or items that players can accumulate and use to increase their chances of succeeding at gigs.

Players may choose to play as one of five different classes of characters: Musician, Hustler, Driver, Drifter or Cook.  Each class has its share of natural and item-related benefits.

Along the way other non-player characters may appear - "Legends" - which, should players encounter them, affect play.  Legends come into play when the board's "Hot Action" counter is raised by various activities.  Legends include Howlin' Wolf and Ol' Scratch.

Name: Spel van het jaar 1998
Description:
Spel van het jaar 1998 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 1997 till October 1998.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

Name: Spel van het jaar 2001
Description:
What happened in the year 2001

Spel van het jaar 2001 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 2000 till October 2001.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

Name: Spel van het jaar 2002
Description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2002 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 2001 till October 2002.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

Name: Hexe Lilli macht Zauberquatsch
Description:
Hexe Lilli (witch Lilli) has a book with many spells. The players have to draw a randomly chosen picture from one side of the book and after a few minutes everybody has to put his picture into the middle of the table. 
Depending on which pictures were drawn, the combination of these pictures have the meaning of different spells.The first player who guessed the right spell, gets three stars from the supply. One of these stars he has to give to the player whose picture he likes most.
The aim of the game is to have the most stars at the end of the game.

Name: Rallyspil
Description: A rally game designed with kids in mind, as they get to know Icelandic geography while playing it. Players draw cards with maps of Iceland on them and on the maps there are rally-routes which they must drive from start to finish. The cards provide some general information on traffic as well, to improve the knowledge of the players.

Name: Cross Cartes
Description:
A race game with tactics and luck. Plays with cards, pawns and board.

"Gobelet d'argent" winner at Boulogne Billancourt's International contest (Concours International de CrÃ©ateurs de Jeux de SociÃ©tÃ©) for board and card games designers for the year 1983.

Name: Pyramid Crawl
Description:
In this solo print-and-play game, you take on the role of an adventurer exploring two levels of a pyramid complex to find the Pharaoh's Tomb. Every character has Strength, Wits, and Magic stats.

Along the way, you encounter ambushes, traps, locked doors, and treasure. You might be attacked by skeletons, mummies, crocodiles, or animal-headed warriors.

If you live to find the Pharaoh's Tomb and escape, your score is the money you collect along the way.
